::: {.cell}

:::

::: {.cell}

:::


The current valid map is identified by **Map code and version**: SM1.2.web.grid v3.0.


> Indicative distributions of Anchialine caves and pools were based on mapped areas of carbonate rock outcrop (Williams & Ting Fong 2016) and lava flows intersecting the coast, which were aggregated within a template of 1-degree grid cells..

::: {.cell}

:::


You can download and use this file from the following sources:

- Zenodo repository (bundle of maps) ([Includes GeoTIFF, GeoJSON and PNG versions in compressed file](http://doi.org/10.5281/zenodo.5090419))
 - Zenodo repository (EFG map) ([Includes GeoTIFF, GeoJSON and PNG files](https://doi.org/10.5281/zenodo.5091035))
 - Mapbox tileset ([GeoTIFF version uploaded to Mapbox](https://studio.mapbox.com/tilesets/jrfep.SM1_2_web_grid))

::: {.cell}

:::

This section provides information about the valid indicative distribution map for the ecosystem functional group [**SM1.2 Anchialine pools**](/efg-info/SM1_2.qmd).


::: {.cell}

:::

## Available maps

These maps are considered current and valid indicative distribution maps for this ecosystem functional group.

- Web navigation (**code: SM1.2.web.grid**, version v3.0) 
 - Indicative Map (**code: SM1.2.IM.grid**, version v3.0) 

## Map files

You can download geospatial data for this map from the following sources:

SM1.2.web.grid (v3.0){target="gisdata"}: [Google Cloud bucket](gs://iucn_get_l3_im/SM1.2.web.grid_v3.0.tif) :: [Zenodo repository (bundle of maps)](http://doi.org/10.5281/zenodo.5090419) :: [Zenodo repository (EFG map)](https://doi.org/10.5281/zenodo.5091035) :: [Mapbox tileset](https://studio.mapbox.com/tilesets/jrfep.SM1_2_web_grid) :: [Earth Engine assets](projects/earthengine-legacy/assets/users/jrferrerparis/IUCN-GET/L3_IndMaps/)
SM1.2.IM.grid (v3.0){target="gisdata"}: [Google Cloud bucket](gs://iucn_get_l3_im/SM1.2.IM.grid_v3.0.tif) :: [Zenodo repository (bundle of maps)](http://doi.org/10.5281/zenodo.3958934)

Note that you need to login to some services like [mapbox](https://www.mapbox.com){target="links"} or [earthengine](https://earthengine.google.com){target="links"}, and in some cases you also need to request access to the files.
